p: The wall materials most used in the techniques are biodegradable polymers. Some usual wall materials used in oil nanoencapsulation are polycaprolactone [ 16, 38, 86, 88], whey protein [ 10, 35], sodium caseinate [ 87], chia seed mucilage [ 37], maltodextrin, or modified starch [ 35] (Fig.Â 3c). Some authors did not report the wall material used in their study [ 88], probably because of the spontaneous emulsification technique that was employed.
